partintro.para: Simpleweb Map Plugin is composed of sample codes created by using a common Controller class and tag libraries that use Map(java.util.Map) Object as Transfer Object and reference libraries necessary to use them to help developers to develop Spring MVC-based web applications more easily and simply.
Install simpleweb-map plugin by entering the following command in the Command window.
The installation result can be checked by using the installed (mvn anyframe:installed) or the jetty:run (mvn clean jetty:run) commands.

In this chapter the way to develop Map-based Simpleweb will be explained centering on Sample Application generated when Simpleweb Map Plugin (simpleweb-map) is installed. The use of link/submit/validator/validate tag, etc. when Map-based Simpleweb is developed is the same as when VO-based Simpleweb is developed explained above. Yet, the part is different that defines modelAttribute and the path of fields in using Spring form tags. When VO is used, the modelAttribute value is defined as an object-type camelcase returned after business service is called (e.g. modelAttribute is defined as "movie" when a Movie-type object is returned.). Yet, when Map is used, the name of modelAttribute should be defined as "result."
Also, the path value of each input field should be defined as "map[${key}]". The example is as follows.
partintro.programlisting: <form:input id="title" path="map[title]" id="title".../> <anyframe:validate id="title" required="true" promptMessage="Enter movie Title." />
partintro.para: It is recommended to define a simple ID, except for "[]", and the validate tag to apply Anyframe validate tag.
